   19: %%
   20: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
   21: %%% Purpose:Stdlib application test suite.
   22: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   23: -module(stdlib_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: %% Prior to OTP 26, maybe_expr used to require runtime support. As it's now
   26: %% enabled by default, all modules are tagged with the feature even when they
   27: %% don't use it. Therefore, we explicitly disable it until OTP 25 is out of
   28: %% support.
   29: -feature(maybe_expr, disable).
   30: -compile(r24).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   34: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   35:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   36:          app_test/1, appup_test/1, assert_test/1]).
   37: 
   38: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> 
   41:     [app_test, appup_test, assert_test].
   42: 
   43: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   44:     Config.
   45: 
   46: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   47:     ok.
   48: 
   49: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   50:     Config.
   51: 
   52: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(appup_test, Config) ->
   56:     %% We check if the test results were released using a version
   57:     %% of Erlang/OTP that was a tagged version or not. On a non-tagged
   58:     %% version this testcase most likely will fail.
   59:     case file:read_file(
   60:            filename:join(
   61:              proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config), "otp_version_tickets")) of
   62:         {ok,<<"DEVELOPMENT",_/binary>>} ->
   63:             {skip, "This is a development version, test might fail "
   64:              "because of incorrect version numbers"};
   65:         {ok,S} ->
   66:             Config
   67:     end;
   68: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: %%
   74: %% Test cases starts here.
   75: %%
   76: %% Application consistency test.
   77: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   78:     test_server:app_test(stdlib),
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: %% Test that appup allows upgrade from/downgrade to a maximum of one
   82: %% major release back.
   83: appup_test(_Config) ->
   84:     appup_tests(stdlib,create_test_vsns(stdlib)).
   85: 
   86: appup_tests(App,{OkVsns0,NokVsns}) ->
   87:     application:load(App),
   88:     {_,_,Vsn} = lists:keyfind(App,1,application:loaded_applications()),
   89:     AppupFileName = atom_to_list(App) ++ ".appup",
   90:     AppupFile = filename:join([code:lib_dir(App),ebin,AppupFileName]),
   91:     {ok,[{Vsn,UpFrom,DownTo}=AppupScript]} = file:consult(AppupFile),
   92:     ct:log("~p~n",[AppupScript]),
   93:     OkVsns =
   94: 	case OkVsns0 -- [Vsn] of
   95: 	    OkVsns0 ->
   96: 		OkVsns0;
   97: 	    Ok ->
   98: 		ct:log("Removed current version ~p from the list of ok versions to test.",
   99: 		      [Vsn]),
  100: 		Ok
  101: 	end,
  102:     ct:log("Testing that appup allows upgrade from these versions: ~p~n",
  103: 	   [OkVsns]),
  104:     check_appup(OkVsns,UpFrom,{ok,[restart_new_emulator]}),
  105:     check_appup(OkVsns,DownTo,{ok,[restart_new_emulator]}),
  106:     ct:log("Testing that appup does not allow upgrade from these versions: ~p~n",
  107: 	   [NokVsns]),
  108:     check_appup(NokVsns,UpFrom,error),
  109:     check_appup(NokVsns,DownTo,error),
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: create_test_vsns(App) ->
  113:     S = otp_vsns:read_state(),
  114:     Rel = list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)),
  115:     AppStr = atom_to_list(App),
  116:     Ok = ok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr),
  117:     Nok0 = nok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr, hd(Ok)),
  118:     Nok = case Ok of
  119:               [Ok1|_] ->
  120:                   [Ok1 ++ ",1" | Nok0]; % illegal
  121:               _ ->
  122:                   Nok0
  123:           end,
  124:     {Ok, Nok}.
  125: 
  126: ok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr) ->
  127:     AppVsns0 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-2, AppStr),
  128:     AppVsns1 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-1, AppStr),
  129:     AppVsns2 = try
  130:                    get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr)
  131:                catch
  132:                    _:_ -> []
  133:                end,
  134:     lists:usort(AppVsns2 ++ AppVsns1 ++ AppVsns0).
  135: 
  136: nok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr, EarliestOkVsn) ->
  137:     AppVsns0 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-4, AppStr),
  138:     AppVsns1 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-3, AppStr),
  139:     %% Earliest OK version may exist in not OK versions
  140:     %% as well if there were no application version bump
  141:     %% between two releases, so we need to remove it
  142:     %% if that is the case...
  143:     lists:usort(AppVsns1 ++ AppVsns0) -- EarliestOkVsn.
  144: 
  145: get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel, App) ->
  146:     RelStr = integer_to_list(Rel),
  147:     OtpVsns = otp_vsns:branch_vsns(S, "maint-"++RelStr),
  148:     lists:map(fun (OtpVsn) ->
  149:                       AppVsn = otp_vsns:app_vsn(S, OtpVsn, App),
  150:                       [_, Vsn] = string:lexemes(AppVsn, "-"),
  151:                       Vsn
  152:               end, OtpVsns).
  153: 
  154: check_appup([Vsn|Vsns],Instrs,Expected) ->
  155:     case systools_relup:appup_search_for_version(Vsn, Instrs) of
  156: 	Expected -> check_appup(Vsns,Instrs,Expected);
  157: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result_for_vsn,Vsn,Other})
  158:     end;
  159: check_appup([],_,_) ->
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: 
  163: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
  164: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl"). % test repeated inclusion
  165: 
  166: %% Assert macros test.
  167: assert_test(_Config) ->
  168:     ok = ?assert(true),
  169:     {'EXIT',{{assert, _},_}} = (catch ?assert(false)),
  170:     {'EXIT',{{assert, Info1},_}} = (catch ?assert(0)),
  171:     {not_boolean,0} = lists:keyfind(not_boolean,1,Info1),
  172: 
  173:     ok = ?assertNot(false),
  174:     {'EXIT',{{assert, _},_}} = (catch ?assertNot(true)),
  175:     {'EXIT',{{assert, Info2},_}} = (catch ?assertNot(0)),
  176:     {not_boolean,0} = lists:keyfind(not_boolean,1,Info2),
  177: 
  178:     ok = ?assertMatch({foo,_}, {foo,bar}),
  179:     {'EXIT',{{assertMatch,_},_}} =
  180:         (catch ?assertMatch({foo,_}, {foo})),
  181: 
  182:     ok = ?assertMatch({foo,N} when N > 0, {foo,1}),
  183:     {'EXIT',{{assertMatch,_},_}} =
  184:         (catch ?assertMatch({foo,N} when N > 0, {foo,0})),
  185: 
  186:     ok = ?assertNotMatch({foo,_}, {foo,bar,baz}),
  187:     {'EXIT',{{assertNotMatch,_},_}} =
  188:         (catch ?assertNotMatch({foo,_}, {foo,baz})),
  189: 
  190:     ok = ?assertNotMatch({foo,N} when N > 0, {foo,0}),
  191:     {'EXIT',{{assertNotMatch,_},_}} =
  192:         (catch ?assertNotMatch({foo,N} when N > 0, {foo,1})),
  193: 
  194:     ok = ?assertEqual(1.0, 1.0),
  195:     {'EXIT',{{assertEqual,_},_}} = (catch ?assertEqual(1, 1.0)),
  196: 
  197:     ok = ?assertNotEqual(1, 1.0),
  198:     {'EXIT',{{assertNotEqual,_},_}} = (catch ?assertNotEqual(1.0, 1.0)),
  199: 
  200:     ok = ?assertException(error, badarith, 1/0),
  201:     ok = ?assertException(exit, foo, exit(foo)),
  202:     ok = ?assertException(throw, foo, throw(foo)),
  203:     ok = ?assertException(throw, {foo,_}, throw({foo,bar})),
  204:     ok = ?assertException(throw, {foo,N} when N > 0, throw({foo,1})),
  205:     {'EXIT',{{assertException,Why1},_}} =
  206:         (catch ?assertException(error, badarith, 0/1)),
  207:     true = lists:keymember(unexpected_success,1,Why1),
  208:     {'EXIT',{{assertException,Why2},_}} =
  209:         (catch ?assertException(error, badarith, 1/length(0))),
  210:     true = lists:keymember(unexpected_exception,1,Why2),
  211:     {'EXIT',{{assertException,Why3},_}} =
  212:         (catch ?assertException(throw, {foo,N} when N > 0, throw({foo,0}))),
  213:     true = lists:keymember(unexpected_exception,1,Why3),
  214: 
  215:     ok = ?assertNotException(throw, {foo,baz}, throw({foo,bar})),
  216:     {'EXIT',{{assertNotException,Why4},_}} =
  217:         (catch ?assertNotException(throw, {foo,bar}, throw({foo,bar}))),
  218:     true = lists:keymember(unexpected_exception,1,Why4),
  219: 
  220:     ok = ?assertError(badarith, 1/0),
  221:     ok = ?assertExit(foo, exit(foo)),
  222:     ok = ?assertThrow(foo, throw(foo)),
  223:     ok.
